intro: Taenitis drymoglossoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree fern, is a species native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a dense crown of fronds. The plant has a unique growth habit, with a short, thick rhizome that supports the upright stem. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with a leathery texture and a dark green color. Taenitis drymoglossoides thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and wetlands.
